title: Why do Turkish people compare their Ottoman sultans to great kings like Alexander the Great or Darius the Great? - Quora

response.answer_text: We do not however some Sultans did compare themselves and it stuck in the minds of the people and carried through ages. Mehmed the Conqueror for example compared himself to Caesar and Alexander the Great. Sometimes when people looked back to an earlier period ( one or two generations back), they sometimes gave them these monikers or titles with nostalgia towards a perceived better period. Lastly other people from different countries have such titles themselves. We definitely don’t call for example Süleyman the Magnificent as such but instead the Lawgiver. Given the size and the scope and the longevity of the Ottomans and considering they lasted longer than other two very comparable Empires of Habsburgs and Romanovs, how their accomplishments can not be compared to others?

We never compare Ottoman Sultans with Alexsander or Darius. Ottoman Sultans were more statesman than conquerors. They spend more time on constituting empire than conquerring. Ottomans were not buble.
